greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Eventual period of a single cell in rule 110 cellular automaton in a cyclic universe of width n.
comment: The first 21 terms match the most frequent possible outcome (see comment in A332717) with the exception of a(14) which is the second-most frequent. - _Hans Havermann_, Jun 11 2020
link: Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
example: For n=4, the evolution of a single cell is:
program: rulemap = dict((tuple(bit(i,k) for k in reversed(range(3))), bit(110,i)) for i in range(8))
def neighbours(d, i): return tuple(d[k % n] for k in [i-1..i+1])
v2 = [rulemap[neighbours(history[-1], i)] for i in range(n)]
if v2 in history: return len(history)-history.index(v2)
results.author: _Ben Branman_, Jan 13 2011
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 14 2011
